meanings.definition: Causing or characterized by scratching or irritation of the skin.
meanings.sent1: The new sweater was scratchy and made my skin itch.
meanings.sent2: The cat's tongue felt scratchy as it licked my hand.
meanings.sent3: I tried to wear the scratchy wool sweater, but it felt like a cactus hugging me.
meanings.sent4: The scratchy tag on the shirt was a constant reminder of discomfort.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy fabric felt like tiny needles against my skin.

meanings.definition: Having a rough or harsh texture.
meanings.sent1: The old tree bark was scratchy to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The sandpaper had a scratchy surface that smoothed the wood.
meanings.sent3: The scratchy carpet felt like walking on a field of prickly thorns.
meanings.sent4: Her voice sounded scratchy, like sandpaper against wood.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy blanket was uncomfortable against my skin.

meanings.definition: Producing a grating or scraping sound.
meanings.sent1: The scratchy sound of the record player made me cringe.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate made a scratchy noise as it opened.
meanings.sent3: The scratchy sound of the chalk on the blackboard echoed in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The scratchy voice on the phone was hard to understand.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy sound of the violin added a haunting quality to the music.
